statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Francis Alonso made four 3-pointers and scored 14 points to lead UNC-Greensboro to an 84-61 victory over Division II Belmont Abbey on Saturday night.
article.headline: Alonso leads UNC-Greensboro over D-II Belmont Abbey 84-61
article.linkText: Alonso leads UNC-Greensboro over D-II Belmont Abbey 84-61
article.story: GREENSBORO, N.C. -- Francis Alonso made four 3-pointers and scored 14 points to lead UNC-Greensboro to an 84-61 victory over Division II Belmont Abbey on Saturday night. Alonso, a freshman, was 5 of 9 from the field in his third career start. Marvin Smith and Kayel Locke added 13 points apiece for UNC-Greensboro (4-5), which plays its next five games on the road before hosting Furman on Jan. 5. RJ White had 12 points, and Demetrius Troy chipped in eight points with six assists and three steals for the Spartans. Deion Lane scored 13 points and Ray Chen had 12 to lead Belmont Abbey. The Spartans closed the first half on a 20-9 run and led 40-24 at halftime. Alonso made two 3s during the stretch. It was the first meeting between the schools.
